verses.verse: וַיַּ֥עַן <WH6030> way·ya·‘an answered: ( Job: How Can I Contend with God?) אִיּ֗וֹב <WH347> ’î·yō·wḇ Then Job וַיֹּאמַֽר׃ <WH559> way·yō·mar ...

אָ֭מְנָם <WH551> ’ā·mə·nām “ Yes, יָדַ֣עְתִּי <WH3045> yā·ḏa‘·tî I know כִי־ <WH3588> ḵî- that כֵ֑ן <WH3651> ḵên [it is] so, וּמַה־ <WH4100> ū·mah- but how יִּצְדַּ֖ק <WH6663> yiṣ·daq be righteous אֱנ֣וֹשׁ <WH582> ’ĕ·nō·wōš can a mortal עִם־ <WH5973> ‘im- before אֵֽל׃ <WH410> ’êl God?

אִם־ <WH518> ’im- If יַ֭חְפֹּץ <WH2654> yaḥ·pōṣ one wished לָרִ֣יב <WH7378> lā·rîḇ to contend עִמּ֑וֹ <WH5973> ‘im·mōw with [God], ( Or If God wished to contend with someone) לֹֽא־ <WH3808> lō- he could not יַ֝עֲנֶ֗נּוּ <WH6030> ya·‘ă·nen·nū answer Him אַחַ֥ת <WH259> ’a·ḥaṯ one [time] מִנִּי־ <WH4480> min·nî- out אָֽלֶף׃ <WH505> ’ā·lep̄ of a thousand.

חֲכַ֣ם <WH2450> ḥă·ḵam [God is] wise לֵ֭בָב <WH3824> lê·ḇāḇ in heart וְאַמִּ֣יץ <WH533> wə·’am·mîṣ and mighty כֹּ֑חַ <WH3581> kō·aḥ in strength. מִֽי־ <WH4310> mî- Who הִקְשָׁ֥ה <WH7185> hiq·šāh has resisted אֵ֝לָ֗יו <WH413> ’ê·lāw Him וַיִּשְׁלָֽם׃ <WH7999> way·yiš·lām and prospered?

הַמַּעְתִּ֣יק <WH6275> ham·ma‘·tîq He moves הָ֭רִים <WH2022> hā·rîm mountains וְלֹ֣א <WH3808> wə·lō without יָדָ֑עוּ <WH3045> yā·ḏā·‘ū their knowledge אֲשֶׁ֖ר <WH834> ’ă·šer [and] הֲפָכָ֣ם <WH2015> hă·p̄ā·ḵām overturns them בְּאַפּֽוֹ׃ <WH639> bə·’ap·pōw in His anger.

הַמַּרְגִּ֣יז <WH7264> ham·mar·gîz He shakes אֶ֭רֶץ <WH776> ’e·reṣ the earth מִמְּקוֹמָ֑הּ <WH4725> mim·mə·qō·w·māh from its place, וְ֝עַמּוּדֶ֗יהָ <WH5982> wə·‘am·mū·ḏe·hā so that its foundations יִתְפַלָּצֽוּן׃ <WH6426> yiṯ·p̄al·lå̄·ṣūn tremble.

הָאֹמֵ֣ר <WH559> hā·’ō·mêr He commands לַ֭חֶרֶס <WH2775> la·ḥe·res the sun וְלֹ֣א <WH3808> wə·lō not יִזְרָ֑ח <WH2224> yiz·rāḥ to shine; ( Or rise) וּבְעַ֖ד <WH1157> ū·ḇə·‘aḏ He seals off כּוֹכָבִ֣ים <WH3556> kō·w·ḵā·ḇîm the stars. יַחְתֹּֽם׃ <WH2856> yaḥ·tōm ...

נֹטֶ֣ה <WH5186> nō·ṭeh stretches out שָׁמַ֣יִם <WH8064> šā·ma·yim the heavens לְבַדּ֑וֹ <WH776> lə·ḇad·dōw He alone וְ֝דוֹרֵ֗ךְ <WH1869> wə·ḏō·w·rêḵ and treads עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- on בָּ֥מֳתֵי <WH1116> bā·mo·ṯê the waves יָֽם׃ <WH3220> yām of the sea.

עֹֽשֶׂה־ <WH6213> ‘ō·śeh- He is the Maker עָ֭שׁ <WH5906> ‘āš of the Bear כְּסִ֥יל <WH3685> kə·sîl [and] Orion, וְכִימָ֗ה <WH3598> wə·ḵî·māh of the Pleiades וְחַדְרֵ֥י <WH2315> wə·ḥaḏ·rê and the constellations תֵמָֽן׃ <WH8486> ṯê·mān of the south.

עֹשֶׂ֣ה <WH6213> ‘ō·śeh He does גְ֭דֹלוֹת <WH1419> ḡə·ḏō·lō·wṯ great things עַד־ <WH5704> ‘aḏ- beyond אֵ֣ין <WH369> ’ên ... חֵ֑קֶר <WH2714> ḥê·qer searching out, וְנִפְלָא֗וֹת <WH6381> wə·nip̄·lā·’ō·wṯ and wonders עַד־ <WH5704> ‘aḏ- ... אֵ֥ין <WH369> ’ên without מִסְפָּֽר׃ <WH4557> mis·pār number.

הֵ֤ן <WH2005> hên Were He יַעֲבֹ֣ר <WH5674> ya·‘ă·ḇōr to pass עָ֭לַי <WH5921> ‘ā·lay by me, וְלֹ֣א <WH3808> wə·lō I would not אֶרְאֶ֑ה <WH7200> ’er·’eh see Him; וְ֝יַחֲלֹ֗ף <WH2498> wə·ya·ḥă·lōp̄ were He to move, וְֽלֹא־ <WH3808> wə·lō- I would not אָבִ֥ין <WH995> ’ā·ḇîn recognize לֽוֹ׃ Prep│3ms ( lōw) Him.

הֵ֣ן <WH2005> hên If יַ֭חְתֹּף <WH2862> yaḥ·tōp̄ He takes away, ( Or snatches someone in death) מִ֣י <WH4310> mî who יְשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ <WH7725> yə·šî·ḇen·nū can stop Him? מִֽי־ <WH4310> mî- Who יֹאמַ֥ר <WH559> yō·mar dares to ask אֵ֝לָ֗יו <WH413> ’ê·lāw Him, מַֽה־ <WH4100> mah- ‘ What תַּעֲשֶֽׂה׃ <WH6213> ta·‘ă·śeh are You doing? ’

אֱ֭לוֹהַּ <WH433> ’ĕ·lō·w·ah God לֹא־ <WH3808> lō- does not יָשִׁ֣יב <WH7725> yā·šîḇ restrain אַפּ֑וֹ <WH639> ’ap·pōw His anger; תַּחַתוֹ <WH8478> ta·ḥa·ṯō beneath Him. שָׁ֝חֲח֗וּ <WH7817> ḥă·ḥū cower עֹ֣זְרֵי <WH5826> ‘ō·zə·rê the helpers רָֽהַב׃ <WH7294> rā·haḇ of Rahab

אַ֭ף <WH637> ’ap̄ How כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- then אָנֹכִ֣י <WH595> ’ā·nō·ḵî can I אֶֽעֱנֶ֑נּוּ <WH6030> ’e·‘ĕ·nen·nū answer Him אֶבְחֲרָ֖ה <WH977> ’eḇ·ḥă·rāh or choose דְבָרַ֣י <WH1697> ḏə·ḇā·ray my arguments עִמּֽוֹ׃ <WH5973> ‘im·mōw against Him?

אֲשֶׁ֣ר <WH834> ’ă·šer For אִם־ <WH518> ’im- even if צָ֭דַקְתִּי <WH6663> ṣā·ḏaq·tî I were right, לֹ֣א <WH3808> lō I could not אֶעֱנֶ֑ה <WH6030> ’e·‘ĕ·neh answer. לִ֝מְשֹׁפְטִ֗י <WH8199> lim·šō·p̄ə·ṭî I could only beg my Judge אֶתְחַנָּֽן׃ <WH2603> ’eṯ·ḥan·nān for mercy.

אִם־ <WH518> ’im- If קָרָ֥אתִי <WH7121> qā·rā·ṯî I summoned Him וַֽיַּעֲנֵ֑נִי <WH6030> way·ya·‘ă·nê·nî and He answered me, לֹֽא־ <WH3808> lō- I do not אַ֝אֲמִ֗ין <WH539> ’a·’ă·mîn believe כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- - יַאֲזִ֥ין <WH238> ya·’ă·zîn He would listen קוֹלִֽי׃ <WH6963> qō·w·lî to my voice.

אֲשֶׁר־ <WH834> ’ă·šer- For בִּשְׂעָרָ֥ה <WH8183> biś·‘ā·rāh with a tempest יְשׁוּפֵ֑נִי <WH7779> yə·šū·p̄ê·nî He would crush me וְהִרְבָּ֖ה <WH7235> wə·hir·bāh and multiply פְצָעַ֣י <WH6482> p̄ə·ṣā·‘ay my wounds חִנָּֽם׃ <WH2600> ḥin·nām without cause.

לֹֽא־ <WH3808> lō- He does not יִ֭תְּנֵנִי <WH5414> yit·tə·nê·nî let me הָשֵׁ֣ב <WH7725> hā·šêḇ catch רוּחִ֑י <WH7307> rū·ḥî my breath, כִּ֥י <WH3588> kî but יַ֝שְׂבִּעַ֗נִי <WH7646> yaś·bi·‘a·nî overwhelms me מַמְּרֹרִֽים׃ <WH4472> mam·mə·rō·rîm with bitterness.

אִם־ <WH518> ’im- If לְכֹ֣חַ <WH3581> lə·ḵō·aḥ it is a matter of strength, אַמִּ֣יץ <WH533> ’am·mîṣ mighty! הִנֵּ֑ה <WH2009> hin·nêh He is indeed וְאִם־ <WH518> wə·’im- If לְ֝מִשְׁפָּ֗ט <WH4941> lə·miš·pāṭ it is a matter of justice, מִ֣י <WH4310> mî who יוֹעִידֵֽנִי׃ <WH3259> yō·w·‘î·ḏê·nî can summon Him? ( See LXX; Hebrew me)

אִם־ <WH518> ’im- Even if אֶ֭צְדָּק <WH6663> ’eṣ·dāq I were righteous, פִּ֣י <WH6310> pî my mouth יַרְשִׁיעֵ֑נִי <WH7561> yar·šî·‘ê·nî would condemn me; תָּֽם־ <WH8535> tām- were blameless, אָ֝֗נִי <WH589> ’ā·nî if I וַֽיַּעְקְשֵֽׁנִי׃ <WH6140> way·ya‘·qə·šê·nî it would declare me guilty. ( Or He would declare me guilty)

תָּֽם־ <WH8535> tām- am blameless, אָ֭נִי <WH589> ’ā·nî Though I לֹֽא־ <WH3808> lō- I have no אֵדַ֥ע <WH3045> ’ê·ḏa‘ concern נַפְשִׁ֗י <WH5315> nap̄·šî for myself; אֶמְאַ֥ס <WH3988> ’em·’as I despise חַיָּֽי׃ <WH2416> ḥay·yāy my own life.

אַחַ֗ת <WH259> ’a·ḥaṯ is all the same, הִ֥יא <WH1931> hî It עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- and so כֵּ֥ן <WH3651> kên ... אָמַ֑רְתִּי <WH559> ’ā·mar·tî I say, תָּ֥ם <WH8535> tām both the blameless וְ֝רָשָׁ֗ע <WH7563> wə·rā·šā‘ and the wicked. ’ ה֣וּא <WH1931> hū ‘ He מְכַלֶּֽה׃ <WH3615> mə·ḵal·leh destroys

אִם־ <WH518> ’i·mō·šō- When שׁ֭וֹט <WH7752> wṭ the scourge יָמִ֣ית <WH4191> yā·mîṯ death, פִּתְאֹ֑ם <WH6597> piṯ·’ōm brings sudden לְמַסַּ֖ת <WH4531> lə·mas·saṯ the despair נְקִיִּ֣ם <WH5355> nə·qî·yim of the innocent. יִלְעָֽג׃ <WH3932> yil·‘āḡ He mocks

אֶ֤רֶץ׀ <WH776> ’e·reṣ The earth נִתְּנָ֬ה <WH5414> nit·tə·nāh is given בְֽיַד־ <WH3027> ḇə·yaḏ- into the hand רָשָׁ֗ע <WH7563> rā·šā‘ of the wicked; פְּנֵֽי־ <WH6440> pə·nê- He blindfolds שֹׁפְטֶ֥יהָ <WH8199> šō·p̄ə·ṭe·hā its judges. יְכַסֶּ֑ה <WH3680> yə·ḵas·seh ... אִם־ <WH518> ’im- If לֹ֖א <WH3808> lō it is not [He], אֵפ֣וֹא <WH645> ’ê·p̄ō·w then מִי־ <WH4310> mî- who הֽוּא׃ <WH1931> hū [is] it?

חָ֭לְפוּ <WH2498> ḥā·lə·p̄ū They sweep by עִם־ <WH5973> ‘im- like אֳנִיּ֣וֹת <WH591> ’o·nî·yō·wṯ boats אֵבֶ֑ה <WH16> ’ê·ḇeh of papyrus, כְּ֝נֶ֗שֶׁר <WH5404> kə·ne·šer like an eagle יָט֥וּשׂ <WH2907> yā·ṭūś swooping down עֲלֵי־ <WH5921> ‘ă·lê- on אֹֽכֶל׃ <WH400> ’ō·ḵel its prey.

לֹ֣א <WH3808> lō Nor יֵשׁ־ <WH3426> yêš- is there בֵּינֵ֣ינוּ <WH996> bê·nê·nū between us, מוֹכִ֑יחַ <WH3198> mō·w·ḵî·aḥ a mediator יָשֵׁ֖ת <WH7896> yā·šêṯ to lay יָד֣וֹ <WH3027> yā·ḏōw his hand עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- upon us שְׁנֵֽינוּ׃ <WH8147> šə·nê·nū both.

יָסֵ֣ר <WH5493> yā·sêr Let Him remove מֵעָלַ֣י <WH5921> mê·‘ā·lay from me, שִׁבְט֑וֹ <WH7626> šiḇ·ṭōw His rod וְ֝אֵמָת֗וֹ <WH367> wə·’ê·mā·ṯōw so that His terror אַֽל־ <WH408> ’al- will no תְּבַעֲתַֽנִּי׃ <WH1204> tə·ḇa·‘ă·ṯan·nî longer frighten me.
